results.title: Republicans in Disarray

media.caption: Democrats had been struggling to make Donald Trump the prime villain in their election narrative. He made it easy by bursting back into the news.
media.copyright: Emil Lippe for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Television;News and News Media;Deaths (Obituaries);Emmy Awards;Indian-Americans;Pemmaraju, Uma (1958-2022);Fox News Channel
results.title: Uma Pemmaraju, an Original Fox News Channel Anchor, Dies at 64
results.abstract: She convinced her Indian parents to allow her to pursue journalism as a career, then went on to win three Emmy Awards.

media.caption: Uma Pemmaraju in 2016. In her nearly 20 years at the Fox News Channel she hosted programs like “Fox News Now,” “Fox on Trends,” the Sunday edition of “Fox News Live” and “The Fox Report.”

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Communism (Theory and Philosophy);Cold War Era;Gorbachev, Mikhail S;Shevardnadze, Eduard A (1928-2014);Yeltsin, Boris N;USSR (Former Soviet Union);Eastern Europe
results.title: Mikhail S. Gorbachev, Reformist Soviet Leader, Is Dead at 91
results.abstract: Adopting principles of glasnost and perestroika, he weighed the legacy of seven decades of Communist rule and set a new course, presiding over the end of the Cold War and the dissolution of the U.S.S.R.

media.caption: Mikhail S. Gorbachev had a profound effect on his time: In little more than six tumultuous years, he lifted the Iron Curtain, transforming the map of Europe and the political climate of the world.
media.copyright: Fred R. Conrad/The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Law and Legislation;Rumors and Misinformation;State Legislatures;Newsom, Gavin;American Medical Assn
results.title: California Approves Bill to Punish Doctors Who Spread False Information
results.abstract: Weighing into the fierce national debate over Covid-19 prevention and treatments, the state would be the first to try a legal remedy for vaccine disinformation.

media.caption: California’s Legislature approved a bill that would allow regulators to punish doctors for spreading false information about Covid-19 vaccinations and treatments.

results.adx_keywords: Weather;Accidents and Safety;Deaths (Fatalities);Rain;Wind;Detroit (Mich);Michigan;Midwestern States (US);Ohio;Toledo (Ohio);Bentonville (Ark);Arkansas;Indiana
results.byline: By Eduardo Medina and Christine Hauser
results.title: Thousands in Michigan Without Power After Midwest Storms Kill 3
results.abstract: A line of storms produced wind gusts from 60 to 80 miles per hour in some areas and knocked out power to thousands of customers in Michigan and Indiana.

results.adx_keywords: Ministers (Protestant);Evangelical Movement;Ethics and Official Misconduct;Chandler, Matt (1974- );Southern Baptist Convention;Village Church (Flower Mound, Tex)
results.byline: By Elizabeth Dias and Ruth Graham
results.title: Prominent Evangelical Pastor Tearfully Steps Aside After ‘Unwise’ Relationship
results.abstract: Matt Chandler’s leave of absence from the Village Church near Dallas comes as Southern Baptists are already facing challenges.

media.caption: Matt Chandler has been the head pastor of the Village Church for about 20 years.

results.adx_keywords: Indigenous People;Deaths (Fatalities);Forests and Forestry;Land Use Policies;Politics and Government;Conservation of Resources;Bolsonaro, Jair (1955- );Brazil;Amazon Jungle
results.byline: By Flávia Milhorance and André Spigariol
results.title: One Man Dies, and an Entire Uncontacted Tribe Vanishes in Brazil
results.abstract: Known as the “Man of the Hole,” the last member of an Indigenous group was found dead this month, marking the first recorded disappearance of an isolated tribe in the country.

media.caption: A still image from a video provided by the Brazilian government showing one of the huts built by the “Man of the Hole” in Rondônia State in 2018.

results.adx_keywords: Colleges and Universities;Student Loans;United States Politics and Government;Polls and Public Opinion;Black People;United States Economy;Vocational Training
results.title: Ted Cruz Would Like to Put Some Words in Your Mouth
results.abstract: The idea that student loan relief is a handout to a small minority of affluent college graduates is simply a myth.

media.copyright: Travis Dove for The New York Times

results.title: Bill Barr Made the Decision to Clear Trump, and That Should Still Frighten Us
results.abstract: The ability to investigate future high-level wrongdoing in the executive branch is at stake.

media.caption: Donald Trump and Attorney General Bill Barr in 2019.

results.adx_keywords: Student Loans;Colleges and Universities;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Education Department (US)
results.title: Why I Changed My Mind on Student Debt Forgiveness
results.abstract: Our current system of student loans and college funding is at odds with what we hope to achieve by encouraging people to go to college.

results.adx_keywords: Sculpture;Art;Police;Juvenile Delinquency;Sculpture Space;Utica (NY)
results.title: A Utica Sculpture Studio Is Ransacked, and 5 Children Are Arrested
results.abstract: Sculpture Space, a residency program, was vandalized over the weekend. The police said Tuesday they had charged five juveniles between the ages of 8 and 11 in connection with the crime.

media.caption: Officials at Sculpture Space, a residency program for artists, shared this photograph showing the damage to its studio in Utica, N.Y., after it was vandalized.

results.adx_keywords: Baseball;Vogelbach, Daniel (1992- );Showalter, Buck;Walker, Taijuan;New York Mets
results.title: Daniel Vogelbach Stays Ready. For the Mets or Any Other Team.
results.abstract: Vogelbach, a left-handed power hitter, has bounced around, but he has loved his stint in Queens — even when his manager gets him warmed up but leaves him on the bench.

media.caption: Daniel Vogelbach has played for five teams since the start of the 2020 season. But he is enjoying his time with the Mets.

results.adx_keywords: Classified Information and State Secrets;Search and Seizure;United States Politics and Government;Cannon, Aileen M;Trump, Donald J;Justice Department;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla);Florida
results.byline: By Charlie Savage, Glenn Thrush and Alan Feuer
results.title: Trump Request for Special Master Could Open Door for Delays to Investigation
results.abstract: The former president, who used the slow pace of litigation to run out the clock on congressional oversight, is seeking intervention that could lead to appeals and slow the documents inquiry.

media.caption: The Justice Department said in a court filing that it had completed a detailed analysis of all the documents retrieved from former President Donald J. Trump’s Florida residence, Mar-a-Lago.
media.copyright: Leigh Vogel for The New York Times

results.title: I’m a Ukrainian Soldier, and I’ve Accepted My Death
results.abstract: So it must be for those who tread the path of war.

media.caption: A mass burial in Bucha, Ukraine, this month.

results.adx_keywords: United States Defense and Military Forces;Monuments and Memorials (Structures);Austin, Lloyd J III;Ku Klux Klan;Defense Department;United States Military Academy;New York State
results.title: West Point Has a K.K.K. Plaque Mounted Above Entrance to Science Hall
results.abstract: A special congressional commission that recommends the removal of Confederate symbols at U.S. military sites flagged the bronze plaque in a new report.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

media.caption: The U.S. Military Academy at West Point. A congressional panel flagged a plaque mounted at the entrance of Bartlett Hall Science Center that includes an image of a hooded figure and the words “Ku Klux Klan.”

results.adx_keywords: Voting Rights, Registration and Requirements;Referendums;Supreme Courts (State);Decisions and Verdicts;United States Politics and Government;Republican Party;Democratic Party;Arizona
results.title: Arizona’s Supreme Court blocks an election reform ballot measure, voiding over 238,000 petition signatures.
results.abstract: The Arizona Free and Fair Elections Act would have established same-day voter registration and prohibited the state Legislature from overturning federal election results.

media.caption: The Arizona Supreme Court affirmed a lower court judge’s earlier decision to reject more than 238,000 signatures from the petition to place the measure on the ballot.
media.copyright: Adriana Zehbrauskas for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);International Relations;Embargoes and Sanctions;Economic Conditions and Trends;Shopping and Retail;Shenyang (China);China;North Korea
results.title: Lockdowns in China, and North Korea, Deal Double Blow to Bridge City
results.abstract: Shenyang, in China’s northeast, was a hub for North Korean workers and a launchpad for visits to Pyongyang. Covid restrictions have battered its economy.

media.caption: Food stalls in Shenyang’s Koreatown. The city used to be a crucial link between China and North Korea, but the pandemic changed that.
media.copyright: Gilles Sabrie for The New York Times

results.title: Aspiring Proud Boy Who Encountered Schumer on Jan. 6 Gets 55 Months in Prison
results.abstract: Joshua Pruitt, 40, came face to face with the senator’s group as it fled to safety during the attack, according to prosecutors.

results.title: Biden Calls Out Republicans on Guns and Crime in Pennsylvania Speech
results.abstract: President Biden took what have been political vulnerabilities for the White House — policing and rising crime — and portrayed them as strengths ahead of the congressional elections in November.

results.title: Paranoia and Pastels at Bama Rush
results.abstract: Fears about TikTok and rumors of a secret documentary swirl around sorority rush week at the University of Alabama.

media.caption: After the sorority rush at the University of Alabama went viral on TikTok last year, the week has taken on new tension.
media.copyright: Jill Frank for The New York Times
